meanings.definition: A single photograph taken with a camera.
meanings.sent1: I took a shot of the sunset at the beach.
meanings.sent2: She framed the shot perfectly before clicking the camera.
meanings.sent3: The shot of the cat wearing sunglasses made me laugh.
meanings.sent4: The shot of the city skyline was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: His shot of the rainbow was so vibrant and clear.

meanings.definition: An attempt to hit a target with a projectile.
meanings.sent1: His shot at the bullseye was almost perfect.
meanings.sent2: The archer's shot landed right on the target.
meanings.sent3: The shot at the flying saucer missed by a mile.
meanings.sent4: Her shot at winning the game was successful.
meanings.sent5: The basketball player's shot from half-court was unbelievable.

meanings.definition: A small amount of liquid, typically alcohol.
meanings.sent1: He poured a shot of tequila into the glass.
meanings.sent2: The bartender served a shot of whiskey to the customer.
meanings.sent3: The shot of rum in the cocktail gave it a kick.
meanings.sent4: She added a shot of vodka to the martini.
meanings.sent5: The shot of brandy warmed him up on a cold night.

meanings.definition: A chance or opportunity to do something.
meanings.sent1: I'll give it a shot and see how it goes.
meanings.sent2: She decided to take a shot at learning a new language.
meanings.sent3: Taking a shot at skydiving was an exhilarating experience.
meanings.sent4: He took a shot at starting his own business.
meanings.sent5: The job interview was her shot at a better career.

meanings.sent1: The shot of thunder startled the children.
meanings.sent2: The shot of the gun echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The shot of the firecracker made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The shot of the cannon signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The shot of the balloon popping was unexpected.
